known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows different daily wage calculation methods between leave policy and payroll settings for unpaid leave. The payroll-side daily wage calculator takes precedence and overrides the leave policy formula, with the leave policy formula appearing greyed out to indicate this override.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage formula in leave policy is not synchronized with payroll settings, causing user confusion about which formula is actually applied.
known_issues.gap_statement: No automatic synchronization mechanism exists between leave policy and payroll daily wage calculator configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculator Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: System requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight variations from manual calculations, with complexity arising from service duration split and tiered gratuity rates
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex logic with different rates for service duration segments
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic may not be immediately transparent to users without detailed explanation

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Handling
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Counted in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates total job tenure with one extra day (623 days instead of 622 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. Discrepancy stems from days worked computation method.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor inconsistency in days worked counting logic
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision in days worked calculation needs review

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates daily wage by dividing salary over a predefined number of days (30 vs 31), which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The calculation follows policy configuration rather than actual calendar days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, potentially causing misalignment with user expectations about prorated calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary monthly due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends on work week configuration, which may not match user's initial expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap exists in handling dynamic proration scenarios for payroll calculations

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Persistence After Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. The system calculates different deduction amounts due to timing mismatches in public holiday configuration, preventing accurate retroactive recalculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unexpected Daily Wage Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display in February Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays an incorrect daily rate in remarks for February, showing 925.81 (based on 31 days) instead of 989.66 (based on 29 days for leap year). However, the actual deduction calculation remains mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The global setting uses a different method than the configured leave policy (Basic Salary / Working Days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic does not preserve the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that stores and shows the rate from the original leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Cannot Be Modified

System gratuity calculation shows slight variations from manual calculations, with complexity arising from service duration split and tiered gratuity rates
The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
